tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We follow two adoptees on a journey to find acceptance. One man whose feelings of rejection have consumed him for over 20 years; and a woman holding off her wedding until she finds her birth mother. (Final)

programme.title: Gardening Australia: Gardener Of The Year Special
programme.desc: We tour the gardens of five finalists for the 2018 Gardener of the Year award. Costa Georgiadis solves inner-city problems in Leigh Sales garden. Millie Ross shows how to make seeding pots from newspaper.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Call The Midwife: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Christmas, 1968. As astronauts embark on their latest space exploration, events continue to unfold at Nonnatus House. Sister Monica Joan believes this will be her last Christmas and may not get to see a man walk on the moon.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The arrival of a long-lost brother to a family-run golf club culminates in a body on the course. But a prime suspect with an alibi leaves the team with an impenetrable conundrum.

programme.title: When The War Is Over
programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths meets artist Ben Quilty to explore the art that not only exposes what happens when the war is over, but helps veterans and their loved ones heal from it.

programme.title: Songs Inside
programme.desc: A group of incarcerated women sign up for a unique songwriting program, which for some opens up deep scars and for others proves to be life-changing.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa visits garden designer Paul Bangay; Sophie Thomson meets school kitchen gardener Stephanie Alexander, Jane Edmanson checks out kentia palms, and Millie Ross starts a vegie bed from scratch.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Kitchen
programme.desc: At this time of the year the heady miasma of spices, citrus fruits and alcohol fills the house. Baking, mulling, larder filling, and fun food to hang on the tree are at the heart of this programme.

programme.title: You Cant Ask That
programme.desc: This episode sets the record straight about what its really like to be judged as fat. Find out the answers to the questions Australians wanted to ask but were too embarrassed or afraid to ever ask in person.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: This week on Hard Quiz, Tom Gleeson faces an onslaught from experts in the North Melbourne Football Club, director Steven Spielberg, the Ford Falcon, and Billie Eilish. Who will win the Big Brass Mug?

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Ballroom meets Kelly Street with Robert Baxter, Angie Hart, Zoe Coombs Marr and Noah Szto to compete for musical trivia glory, while diagnosing musos and spanking Frank Sinatra. Paul Dempsey turns back time with his cover.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Join the doctors for a journey around the human body as they look at their favourite bits from your head to your toes.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Sad Little Sister
programme.desc: Special guest stars Al Murray and The League Of Gentlemens Reece Shearsmith, Mark Gatiss and Steve Pemberton join the Horrible Histories cast today for more fascinating facts, mirthful music and gruesome gags.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: After Alixs friends break her fathers priceless watch, she is akumatized into Timebreaker, travelling back in time to save the watch.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Torrential rain threatens to ruin the annual Sheep Dog trials, but The Farmer begs the judges for an opportunity to show off his talented Flock.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Its poptastic! The doctors put your acoustic reflex to the test with an enormous balloon. And a serious case of snotting awaits the loser of todays Ouchology.

programme.title: Animals Up Close With Bertie Gregory
programme.desc: Bertie films a pack of African wild dogs in Botswana to find out what it will take for the next generation of these endangered predators to survive.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand get to grips with the heart and show how to build a pumping heart model in todays DO try this at home experiment.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Feeling inadequate as a superhero, Buttercup bulks up... to the max.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Its superhero time as the Doctors alter-egos go into battle to show the secret powers of your skin, which uses Vitamin D from the sun to make your bones strong!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Disoriented Drone
programme.desc: After a little girls drone is blown away, the Inbestigators must prove that a boy in a neighbouring house has claimed it as his own.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi discover a long lost ship.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer expects the windows of his farmhouse to be spotless, so Bitzer calls on the services of the Flock to help him clean them. Will Bitzer be able to clear up the mess before the Farmer returns?

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda Holiday
programme.desc: Follows the lovable Po the panda who must choose between his responsibilities as the Dragon Warrior and his family traditions with his father Mr Ping during the Winter Festival.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven urges Amethyst and Pearl to fuse into a giant four-armed woman named Opal (voiced by Aimee Mann). Amethyst and Pearl, however, will not stop squabbling.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Its a normal day for the Bears. That means Ice gets in a fight with a Roomba, Pandas life gets turned upside down when a mouse invades his room, and Grizz gets stuck in a tree. You know, everyday stuff for a bear.

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Eddie agrees to take Alison to see a remake of Romeo and Juliet for their anniversary. Jessica gets called for jury duty and campaigns to be the "Jury Boss", while Emery and Evan learn how to raise a Tamagotchi virtual pet.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Having tried every fad diet, Eddy is desperate to shift the kilos; to be thin, do thin things and to take her clothes off without being marked by them. Is detox the answer?

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Find out how amazing your hands are in todays lab when the doctors go head to head in a thumb challenge, and discover how drones are helping emergency rescue crews reach patients fast in Investigation Ouch.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Worship Me! Give Praise Unto Me! The Explosive Birth Of A Merged Zamasu!
programme.desc: Vegetas rage inspires Black to draw upon his own anger and unleash a devastating new ability. Mortal arrogance is proving to be a large enough thorn in Future Zamasus side that a permanent decision must be made!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When the Farmer pops out for more supplies, Bitzer is left in charge of decorating and calls on the Flock for help. He soon realises this may be a terrible mistake as they have their own way of doing things...

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: I Put A Hex On You!
programme.desc: The Hex Girls need Mystery, Inc. for a cursed guitar.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: The Bears are invited to live with a family of cavemen but things get rocky when the bears teach the family about television.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.sub-title: The Weight Of The World Depends On Orla
programme.desc: Orla shares the story of how she was chosen to protect the 44-leaf clover in order to stop the villain, Jellybean Joe, from causing oddness to the Mobile Unit van.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Gladiator Dynamite puts Dr Dan and Dr Raphs core muscles to the test, Dr Chris shoots hoops with a basketball dunking champ, while Dr Ronx is lifted into the air by finger power!

programme.title: BTN
programme.desc: Social Media Survey Results; PM Press Conference; International Reactions; Quitting Social Media

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels to Lincolnshire to try to help downsizers Mark and Tina sell their detached three bed house. But the house is so over personalised, a prospective purchaser will never be able to picture themselves living there.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: In West Sussex, Phil helps Phil and Sandy Drake. Approaching retirement, this adventurous couple dream of travelling in their campervan with their dog. Theres just one small problem, they need to sell their house to do so.

programme.title: Mother And Son
programme.desc: When Maggie falls for a suave Activities Director on a family holiday, Arthur suspects Ronaldo is out to exploit Maggie, while Robbies sure Liz is getting more than just upgrades from the Resort Manager.

programme.title: Rage Vault: Oz 1985
programme.desc: From David Byrne to Midnight Oil, INXS, Models, Big Pig, The Church and more, rage delves into the Vault to bring you the best Australian Clips of 1985.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts a Ridiculous episode of QI, which asks impossible questions and doesnt care whether the answers are "right or not" - just as long as they are interesting.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.sub-title: How Your Reflexes Can Save You
programme.desc: Dr Xand invents a crazy game show to put Dr Chris reactions and reflexes to the test in the lab, and Dr Ronx heads out on call with the emergency services.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Final Judgment?! The Ultimate Power Of An Absolute God
programme.desc: Zamasu and Black merge into an immortal being with limitless power. Is this the end of Future Trunks world? Is there any hope left for a victory?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmers niece has come to visit, bringing her pet rabbit. When the rabbit disappears Shaun and the Flock are called to action to help track down the illusive pet before the niece discovers its missing.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: The High School Wolfmans Musical Lament!
programme.desc: The gang join Christian Slater to stop a Wolfman.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: On the Bears visit to a medieval vegetable-village, Grizz starts to believe that hes the rightful king.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Cool C and K, the king of kicking, team up to play a football match against a giant sock. This episode introduces the letters C and K, the pair CK, and the words cot, kit, kid, can, cat, sock, sack and kick.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Could farts power a rocket? And Gladiator Dynamite tests Dr Dan and Dr Raphs dunking skills in an epic Body Battle!

programme.title: Horrible Science
programme.sub-title: A Meteor for the Dinosaurs, Binary Bangers and Perilous Plants
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix stars in Scientific First Dates, Binary Bangers brings you the hits, Marie Curie reacts to space, and the dinosaurs get an unwelcome musical meteor visitor.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: In West Sussex, Phil helps Phil and Sandy Drake. Approaching retirement, this adventurous couple dream of travelling in their campervan with their dog. Theres just one small problem, they need to sell their house to do so.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie delve into a world of massive sound systems, amplifiers and sub woofers to find out if a sound system can destroy the car and, the build team hit the rough road to take on a tall tale from down under.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels to Stockton Heath, Warrington where couple Pauline and Alan want to downsize now their children have left home. The property has been on the market for three months without any offers so Phil is stepping in.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The arrival of a long-lost brother to a family-run golf club culminates in a body on the course. But a prime suspect with an alibi leaves the team with an impenetrable conundrum.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Yoda gives the younglings a mission.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle wants bread for his Royal breakfast, but there isnt any flour in the castle. Mr Elf takes Holly, Ben and Nanny Plum to the Elf Windmill to find out why it takes so long to make flour.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: Toodloo shows her balancing skills and Great BigHoo, while Chickedy and Chick run and roll out of the way.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel and his friends have to leave school early because theres a big snowstorm headed their way. Daniel is feeling frightened, but the grown-ups in his life are there to keep him safe.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and everybodys celebrating at Bings house! They all gather to open presents. Bing finally opens his Hoppity Voosh Rocket Sledge, but theres no snow! Bing waits for the snow to come.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to visit a house that Mr Bull is building. Who will their new neighbours be?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: The children want to camp out for the night in the treehouse. Mr Brown is worried he wont get sleep as the kids will be scared. Paddington wants to prove him wrong, but a lightning storm means they have to come in doors.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and Father Christmas is making his deliveries to children around the world. Meanwhile King and Queen Thistle are stuck as well as the Wise Old Elf who is stuck in a Christmas tree.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are on a caravan adventure and the first stop is The Biggest Potato in the World. However, when it starts to get too foggy, they park up for a rest before another busy day.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When a young Watermelonsuchus gets beached during a heatwave, Ginger and the Baby Pea Rexes have to get creative to work out a way to get the giant baby into the water.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Mixed Up Whales
programme.desc: When the Octonauts clean and repair their ship, the Octopod, the resulting noise causes a nearby Blue Whale to act in strange and dangerous ways.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: The whole family are in the car on their way to the seaside. However, they are currently stuck in a traffic jam for the ferry.

programme.title: Play School: Let The Games Begin
programme.desc: Miah and Zindzi make a splash with water sports! Olympic Diver Sam Fricker joins Miah to commentate a diving event between toys Little Ted, Kiya and Fergus. Zindzi, Miah and Sam perform a synchronised swimming routine.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Superstar Papaya
programme.desc: Jay is totally taken with a green papaya that Appa grew for a sambar dinner/recipe. Will they be able to find it when it goes missing?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Luckys Dad is outraged that modern Pass the Parcel has a present in every layer and changes the rules back to only having one prize in the middle, but Bingo is forever losing.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In South America the Mini Makers create a monster-sized plant picture; in Australia find out if he can make a bottle top cake in under a minute; and in Hong Kong a Mini Maker makes a cool creature with a fabulous fan.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Thomas and Diesel compete in an impromptu speed contest while carrying prized cakes for Sodors Cake Festival, they cause a disaster that really takes the cake... in fact, all of them!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family spend the day jumping in different types of puddles but one type is still the best puddle in the world.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger encounters an injured Mamma Pea-Rex who quickly befriends the baby Pea-Rexes. Ginger goes off to play alone and lands herself in trouble but is rescued by some unexpected friends.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When their barber goes on vacation ahead of Robotics Team picture day, the Dream Factory Crew build a grooming robot to get themselves ready for their close-up.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts evacuate the creatures living around a reef before a large archway collapses, but one stubborn convict fish refuses to move from her burrow.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Tobys passengers cant stop making fun of him, but they soon change their mind when he stops two villains trying to steal King Godreds Crown.

programme.title: Play School: When I Grow Up
programme.desc: Alex and Matt learn all about health care jobs! Nurse Ari explains how nurses take care of people, and Nurse Jemima flies her rescue helicopter to help injured toys! Matt the Vet visits Alex who is a very hoarse horse!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas Playgroup have a new friend to meet - Mandy Mouse. Mandy uses a wheelchair. The children have a lot of fun playing with Mandy as she is super sporty and loves to play games.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizards found an epic crystal and Cosima is jealous. Their squabbling peaks at the top of the volcano! Will they learn to share before its too late?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: A celebrity quokka visits Kangaroo Beach to film an episode of the smash hit TV series Wallaby Waters.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Pirate Robot wants to upgrade his ship stuff from the Flying Factory.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington and Simi go on a magical journey into the human body to see if an apple pip grows into a tree if you swallow one.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly goes with Ben and Mr Elf to the elf farm to collect an egg for the Kings breakfast. While there a huge chicken escapes from the farm and Holly and the elves have to chase it across the Little Kingdom.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bams new powers are stronger than he can control!

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nashs Jedi friends help her compete in a race.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Snobby King and Queen Marigold are coming to visit the Little Kingdom, and Holly and her Mummy and Daddy enlist the Elf Band to impress them.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The colourful bird-like creatures use a pump to help inflate a giant dinosaur for a bunch of children, and the Robot visits the Big Red Rocket.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel and his friends have to leave school early because theres a big snowstorm headed their way. Daniel is feeling frightened, but the grown-ups in his life are there to keep him safe.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula is painting Biteysaurus on Bings face, starting with Biteys signature green. When she accidentally adds purple, Bing wants Sula to go home. Flop adds teeth to Bing so he can be Bitey!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children are taught how to play basketball by Daddy coach. They are soon good enough to take on a bigger team.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr Gruber gives Paddington a box of magic tricks, but Paddington cannot master the tricks until he learns to practice, practice, practice.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The children are playing a game of superheroes. When Strawberry takes her super villain role a bit too far, it is up to the Elf Man and Fairy Girl to save the day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: After Peppa and family visit a tourist spot with her new friend Birgit Bear, the caravan unhooks from the car! Luckily, the bear family stop it just in time and they finish the day jumping muddy puddles at the caravan park.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Split chases a glowing Chillipede into the depths of the Spooky Forest and gets lost inside an overgrown tree-root maze, where the only way out is to follow the sounds of Ginger and the other Baby Pea-Rexes.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Giant Kelp Forest
programme.desc: When Kwaziis favourite sub, the Gup-B goes missing, the Octonauts journey into a mysterious kelp forest to find it, meeting strange and interesting creatures along the way.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Bobby and Tish are outside in the garden having a picnic, they each have one cookie left each. Tish gobbles hers up like a cookie eating monster but before Bobby can eat his, an ant steals it away!

programme.title: Play School: Let The Games Begin
programme.desc: Abi and Kaeng have a blast playing ball sports! They are joined by Australian soccer players, Jada Whyman and Abbey Lemon, for an intense game of soccer with the toys. Abi and Kaeng play a long game of cricket.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Magic Trick
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay have planned a magic trick for Jims birthday, but Nikhil has a nervous monster in his tummy. Can they perform the best trick of all and make the monster disappear?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: While waiting to be picked up from school, Jack plays at being a sailor trying to find his way back home to Australia. Meanwhile, Jacks Dad has got lost on route to collect him.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In the UK, how to make a cheeky apple surprise in under a minute; the Mini Makers build a super crocodile swamp in South America; and in South Africa, look out for a sensational silhouette inspired by a graceful giraffe.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Whiff has to leave Sodor for the day, the recycling responsibilities fall behind schedule! Thomas decides to get the Troublesome Trucks to help pick up the slack.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children have a music lesson with Madame Gazelle and all learn how to play the recorder. After lots of practising at home, the children put on a wonderful performance for all the parents to enjoy.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Gingers baby Broccolisaurus friend kicks their ball into Potatodon territory. Now they have challenge the Potatodons to a game to win it back.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew, Carlos and his pet cockatiel, Leon, make new friends when another cockatiel flies into the Dream Factory and their adventures begin.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When surfing snails are swept out to sea by a huge wave, its up to Dashi and the Octonauts to save them before their bubble rafts pop!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Percy causes confusion and delay by panicking over nothing.

programme.title: Play School: When I Grow Up
programme.desc: Teo and Michelle are joined by Nate Byrne for the Play School Jobs Expo where Humpty is searching for a job. Michelle dresses up as a bus driver and Nate tells the story of Kiya and Maurice inventing a Supersonic Solar Car!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig is persuaded by Miss Rabbit to come along to her relaxation class to help Mummy Pig relax but actual relaxing proves to be more challenging than expected.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: A dragonfly steals a bee cocoon that Cosima had vowed to keep safe. Cosima and Big Lizard give chase, leading to a surprising solution with a vacuum cleaner and some sticky vines!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Frizzy and Gemma investigate the mysterious disappearance of several boats in Kangaroo Beachs Barramundi Triangle.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Luna secretly steals Motsukis teleport power. Gekko and Catboy investigate, but mess up with catastrophic results... Can they find it in themselves to put it right?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr Curry is sure theres a monster in the park lake and Paddington sets out to help him prove it.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly and her friends must stay in the courtyard and play with Hollys little twin sisters Daisy and Poppy. All is fine until the twins borrow a magic wand.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird gets excited when he and Bam go for a drive up the coast!

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We follow two adoptees on a journey to find acceptance. One man whose feelings of rejection have consumed him for over 20 years; and a woman holding off her wedding until she finds her birth mother. (Final)

programme.desc: We tour the gardens of five finalists for the 2018 Gardener of the Year award. Costa Georgiadis solves inner-city problems in Leigh Sales garden. Millie Ross shows how to make seeding pots from newspaper.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Thousands of homes left without power as a Category 3 cyclone tears through the Top End, grape growers grapple with forecast record low prices, and the holiday hotspots pricing people out of their own homes.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Heywire
programme.desc: Discover the voices of young Australians as they share powerful, lived experiences from life in regional communities. Stories from the 2025 Heywire project that celebrate resilience, creativity and the spirit of the regions.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.sub-title: Matt Keogh - Minister for Veterans Affairs and Defence Personnel
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas speaks with politicians and key players, plus what weve heard at the National Press Club and Senate Estimates.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget, James, Catherine and the team share highlights from the shows trip to Canberra plus chats with Russell Crowe, AFLW best and fairest winner Ash Riddell, movie critic Zak Hepburn, and a dance lesson with Bluey too.
